description: drawing of sculpted head of woman with round face and rather thick neck; hair in waves--wearing headband
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

on verso, in black ink: [Roma 30 May 1776 - Testa di Giunone - nel Campidoglio = 4 b.re.]; on back, in pencil: [P 64-2=131]
markings:
LRC, collector\'s stamp in black: [REMEMBER. / (unicorn) / GH], not in Lugt [George Horne\'s mark]

Watermark, partial: \"IV\" or \"IX\" or \"LV\"
provenance: George Horne (born 1734), ' his stamp (not in Lugt), Paxton and Wedderburn; by descent to Henry Percy Horne, cf. Lugt 2804 (1841-1926), London. [Alistair Mathews, Bournemouth, England, until 1974; sold September 8, for Â£20, as Campana, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1974-d. 2010; bequeathed to Mia)
title: Head of Empress Sabina
